name: How do Recipro-Damage Caster Builds work?
author: blksabbath74

posts.author: blksabbath74
posts.content:
I saw on of these scrolling through, and wanted to better understand how they work.

Thanks in advance.

posts.author: blksabbath74
posts.content: Also, in general, what spells are effective for a sub-optimal caster level?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Wizards, in general, have two spells that are doing heavy damage (120 plus, if both are active) against those who strike them in melee.
These spells are a flame-shield (like fire shield-red/blue from ad&d) and an acid-shield respectively.
But wait, aren't wizards in general fragile with low constitution & hit points?
So, there comes the "optimized" part. You can do it in two ways, one requires a spell, the other a class.
The spell is shapechange into an Iron Golem which makes you immune to a ton of stuff, including criticals & sneaks plus giving you hundreds of temporary hit points.
The class is Pale Master and it does the same thing basically, but constantly.
Of course, a wise warrior would never engage the wizard in melee when the shields are up, which in turn suits the wizard just fine cause he now has all the time in the world to fry the poor warrior with his spells.
Of course, things are more complicated than that, with counters & anti-counters for both sides, but those are the basics so you can understand how this works in general.

Here is an example, a build that uses pale-master plus high constitution & some DR to complement the reciprocate-shield strategy.
Mestil's Pale Emissary => http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 52820.html
